SEARCH
Module it.polimi.ingsw.am16
Package it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.view.cli

Class CLIPlayArea

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.am16.client.view.cli.CLIPlayArea
public class CLIPlayArea extends Object
Utility class to manage a player's play area in the Command Line Interface. This class handles placing cards and position labels on the play area, as well as initializing a play area with the player's starter card. This class also handles the player's info table and places the points table beside the play area itself.

  • Constructor Details

    • CLIPlayArea

      public CLIPlayArea(List<Position> cardPlacementOrder, Map<Position,BoardCard> field, Map<BoardCard,SideType> activeSides, Set<Position> legalPositions, Set<Position> illegalPositions, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts, List<String> playerUsernames, Map<String,PlayerColor> playerColors, Map<String,Integer> gamePoints, Map<String,Integer> objectivePoints)
      Creates a new play area and initializes it with the given information.
      Parameters:
      cardPlacementOrder - The order in which the cards in field were placed.
      field - The map containing all the cards in the position they were played in.
      activeSides - A map detailing what side is active for each card.
      legalPositions - The set of positions where a card can currently be placed.
      illegalPositions - The set of position where a card can currently not be played.
      resourceCounts - A map containing the amount of each resource currently visible on the player's play area.
      objectCounts - A map containing the amount of each object currently visible on the player's play area.
      playerUsernames - A list containing the usernames of the player in the game.
      playerColors - A map detailing each player's color.
      gamePoints - A map containing each player's amount of game points.
      objectivePoints - A map containing each player's amount of objective points.

    • CLIPlayArea

      public CLIPlayArea()
      Creates a new empty play area. Used mainly for testing.

  • Method Details

    • addCard

      public void addCard(BoardCard card, SideType side, Position position, Set<Position> addedLegalPositions, Set<Position> removedLegalPositions, Map<ResourceType,Integer> resourceCounts, Map<ObjectType,Integer> objectCounts)
      Adds a card to this play area and updates its info table.
      Parameters:
      card - The card that was played.
      side - The side on which the card was played.
      position - The position where the card was played.
      addedLegalPositions - The set of new positions where a card can be placed.
      removedLegalPositions - The set of positions where a card can no longer be placed.
      resourceCounts - The updated map containing the amounts of each resource currently visible on the player's play area.
      objectCounts - The updated map containing the amounts of each object currently visible on the player's play area.

    • updatePoints

      public void updatePoints(Map<String,Integer> gamePoints, Map<String,Integer> objectivePoints)
      Updates the points on the points table.
      Parameters:
      gamePoints - The updated map containing each player's amount of game points.
      objectivePoints - The updated map containing each player's amount of objective points.

    • initializeText

      private void initializeText()
      Initializes this play area's CLIText with all the cards and puts all the position labels where a card can currently be placed. Should only be used when creating a new play area.

    • mergeCard

      private void mergeCard(BoardCard card, Position pos)
      Adds the given card to this play area's CLIText representation.
      Parameters:
      card - The new card to add.
      pos - The position where the card should be added.

    • addPositionLabel

      private void addPositionLabel(Position pos)
      Adds a position label at the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position where the new label should be placed.

    • removePositionLabel

      private void removePositionLabel(Position pos)
      Removes a label, if present, from the specified coordinates.
      Parameters:
      pos - The position where the label should be removed, if present.

    • putPositionLabel

      private void putPositionLabel(CLIPositionLabelAsset label, Position pos)
      Actually merges a new position label in this play area's CLIText.
      Parameters:
      label - The label to be merged.
      pos - The position where the new label should be merged.

    • placePointsTable

      private void placePointsTable(CLIText toPrintText, int startRow, int startCol)
      Merges this play area's points table with the provided CLIText that is about to be printed.
      Parameters:
      toPrintText - The CLIText that is about to be printed. Note: this should not be this play area's original CLIText; instead, a copy should always be used for this method.
      startRow - The row where the top-left corner of the points table should go.
      startCol - The column where the top-left corner of the points table should go.

    • placeInfoTable

      private void placeInfoTable(CLIText toPrintText, int startRow, int startCol)
      Merges this play area's info table with the provided CLIText that is about to be printed.
      Parameters:
      toPrintText - The CLIText that is about to be printed. Note: this should not be this play area's original CLIText; instead, a copy should always be used for this method.
      startRow - The row where the top-left corner of the info table should go.
      startCol - The column where the top-left corner of the info table should go.

    • printPlayArea

      public void printPlayArea()
      Prints this play area to the terminal, including its info table and the points table. If the play area is too big, only a portion will be visible. The portion that is visible can be changed with the moveView(int) method.

    • moveView

      public void moveView(int offset)
      Changes the portion of this play area that is currently visible.
      Parameters:
      offset - The amount of "card-length"s to move the view of. Positive numbers indicate movement to the right; negative numbers indicate movement to the left.
